Package http.server

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
http.server.WebServer
public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton WebServer is a very simple web-server. Any request is responded with a very simple web-page. HTTP request handlers added by Gustavo Bertoldi and Maria Lemes

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private static void doDelete​(java.lang.String ressourceName, java.io.OutputStream clientOutput)
    Handles a DELETE request, deleting the ressource if it exists
    private static void doGet​(java.lang.String ressourceName, java.io.OutputStream clientOutput)
    Handles a GET request, receiving the demanded ressource and and sending it to the client, if it exists
    private static void doHead​(java.lang.String ressourceName, java.io.OutputStream clientOutput)
    Handles a HEAD request, sending information to the client about the demanded ressource
    private static void doPost​(java.lang.String ressourceName, java.io.OutputStream clientOutput, java.io.BufferedReader clientIn)
    Handles a POST request, writting the data sent by the client in the target ressource, id the target ressource exists already, data is added, ressource is created otherwise.
    private static void doPut​(java.lang.String ressourceName, java.io.OutputStream clientOutput, java.io.BufferedReader clientIn)
    Handles a PUT request, updating the target ressource, if it exists, with the data sent by the client.
    private static java.lang.String getContentType​(java.lang.String ressourceName)
    returns the content type of a ressource, or null if the ressource is not supported
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Start the application.
    private static java.lang.String makeHeader​(java.lang.String status, java.lang.String contentType, long contentLength)
    Returns a string with the header to be sent to the client

      clientOut - client output stream
      clientIn - client input stream

    • doPost

      private static void doPost​(java.lang.String ressourceName, java.io.OutputStream clientOutput, java.io.BufferedReader clientIn)
      Handles a POST request, writting the data sent by the client in the target ressource, id the target ressource exists already, data is added, ressource is created otherwise.
      Parameters:
      ressourceName - the request text
      clientOutput - client output stream
      clientIn - client input stream
